Class Pixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pixel

  • public class Pixel
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple Pixel class. A pixel is an array of float data. Typically, a pixel has three bands (for RGB colourspaces), but Pixel can have an arbitrary band count. Pixel also provides convenience methods for RGB[A] pixels when an RGB[A] pixel is ordered 0,1,2[,A].

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int bands
      The band count
      protected float[] p
      The pixel data, a float array

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pixel()
      Creates a Pixel with the default 3 bands and sets all data to zero.
      Pixel(float[] data)
      Creates a pixel from a float array.
      Pixel(int bands)
      Creates a pixel with an arbitrary number of bands and sets all data to zero.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pixel

        public Pixel()
        Creates a Pixel with the default 3 bands and sets all data to zero.

      • Pixel

        public Pixel(int bands)
        Creates a pixel with an arbitrary number of bands and sets all data to zero.
        Parameters:
        bands - The number of bands

      • Pixel

        public Pixel(float[] data)
        Creates a pixel from a float array. The number of bands will be the length of the float array.
        Parameters:
        data - The float data to convert to a Pixel

      • set

        public void set(float[] values)
        Set a pixel from float data.
        Parameters:
        values - The float data. Must have at least as many elements as the pixel has bands.
